page.title: 06A NEWCOMER'S FAMILY
page.content: Within sight of the Brook family home at Clock House Farm is Waterhall Cottage.The young people who live there,like the Brooks,love the Sampfords countryside.Unlike them,they have only been there for two and a half years.The two families epitomise the contempory rural population.Paul and Phyllis Hunter came to Waterhall Cottage to escape the noise and bustle of town life although they still commute daily to London where Paul works as a lawyer. Phyllis comes from the State of Massachusetts in America and in the eight years she has lived here has come to love England.Their home is typical of the area,a small timber framed,plastered thatched cottage in a small garden with beautiful views over the surrounding countryside.Two village families,two generations enjoying country life.
